page.title: 08Farm Survey (cont)
page.content:
The abbatoir is at Fontley, near Portsmouth. The calves come from S.Wales. The farmer likes to grow his own barley and hay for his animals. He has his own ploughs, drills, sprayer, combine harvester, grain drier and roll bailer.
On Thursday 27th June we went to visit School Farm grid ref.305361. We were met by the manager of the farm. He showed us a map of the farm and we thought the names of the fields were very interesting as they told us where to find them. One field down by the water meadows, grid ref. 307261, is called the Sling. The other names are Pub Paddock, Street Farm Paddock, Butts Green Paddock, Stable Paddock; these fields are used to graze horses or for hay. The stables are with the farm buidings, just S of the area.
